intro: Ebenus humilis, commonly known as the dwarf thornweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Ebenus humilis is used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
